0.title: The Sun
0.info:
The Sun is the star at the center of 
our Solar System. It is a nearly perfect 
sphere of hot plasma heated to 
incandescence by nuclear fusion 
reactions in its core, radiating the energy 
mainly as visible light and infrared 
radiation
0.facts: Distance from sun: 0.4 AU or 59,840,000 km

1.title: Mercury
1.facts: Distance from sun: 0.4 AU or 59,840,000 km | Orbital Period: 87.9691 days | Average Orbital Speed: 47.362 km/s | Average Diameter: 4880 km | Volume: 6.083 x 10 <sup>10</sup> km (0.056 Earths) | Mass: 3.3011 x 10<sup>23</sup> kg (0.055 Earths) | Average Density: 5.427 g/cm<sup>3</sup> | Surface Gravity: 3.7 m/s<sup>2</sup> | Escape Velocity: 4.25 km/s | Temperature Range (At Equator): 100 - 700 K (-173 - 426 <sup>o</sup>C)
